page.title: 19COMMUNITY PROBLEMS
page.content: A landscape, highly rated as a conser- vation area, is very low on the list for development and provision of amen- ities. A 1984 Village Appraisal asks: "What do you do with a Bishopsbourne landscape which has outlived the social and economic conditions which created it?" The dilema is how can the community evolve and grow, yet retain its unique rural character? In recent years, people have left the parish ow- ing to the absence of suitable houses. More housing of tasteful design would be desirable for young people and fam- ilies but often planning policies work against this. A larger, well-balanced population would help revitalise the community and give support to its trade and social life. The Appraisal highlighted other concerns including: traffic congestion and lack of public transport, amenities and entertainment
